basics.name: Abhilesh Dhawanjewar
basics.summary: As an Integrative Researcher, I leverage my robust background in quantitative methods and analytical thinking to work effectively with diverse biological data. My passion lies in amalgamating insights from various knowledge streams, aiming to cultivate a comprehensive understanding of Life on Earth.

education.institution: Indian Institute of Science Education and Research, Pune

work.name: University College London
highlights: Designed experimental evolution study to identify sexually antagonistic genetic variants
Developed analytical pipelines to simulate and analyze population genetic data

work.name: University of Nebraska-Lincoln
work.summary: Coevolution between the mitochondrial and nuclear genomes
highlights: Characterized the impact of a mito-nuclear incompatibility on male sterility
Developed integrative pipeline for sequence, structure and phylogenetic characterization of mitochondrial disease-causing mutations
Performed phylogenetic analysis to identify coevolutionary patterns in mammlian mitochondrial and nuclear genomes

work.name: Indian Institute of Science Education and Research, Pune
highlights: Developed a novel scoring function for the prediction of protein-protein interactions
Implemented the method as a web-server for public use

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Multilevel Selection on Mitochondrial Genomes
publications.summary: Review article on the evolutoinary dynamics of mitochondrial genomes across multiple levels of biological organization.

publications.name: A Knowledge-Based Scoring Function to Assess Quaternary Associations of Proteins
publications.summary: Describes a novel scoring function for the prediction of protein-protein interactions.

publications.name: Temperature-Sensitive Reproduction and the Physiological and Evolutionary Potential for Mother's Curse
publications.summary: Investigates the impact of deleterious mito-nuclear interactions on the temperature sensitivity of male reproduction.

publications.name: UNVEILing Connections between Genotype, Phenotype, and Fitness in Natural Populations
publications.summary: Review article outlining the latest developments in the field of evolutionary genetics presented at the UNVEIL conference.

publications.name: Protein Interaction Z Score Assessment (PIZSA): An Empirical Scoring Scheme for Evaluation of Protein-Protein Interactions
publications.summary: Describes a novel scoring function for the prediction of protein-protein interactions implemented as a web-server for public use.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
